body.name: RELODICA Montessori Toddler Busy Board, 27 LED Lights Montessori Toys for 1-6 Year Old, Wooden Sensory Toy for Boys & Girls Gifts
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35
Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 20 hrs 33 mins
features: 【 Play while learning 】This busy board is specially designed for toddlers who love switches and LED lights. This Montessori Toys is set up with 10 different switches, total 27 LED lights for your baby. The brightness of each LED is adjusted to suit the baby, protecting their eyes while learning.

【Suitable for all places】This sensory boy toy will exercise your baby's hands and thinking skills. And whether it's in a car, a plane, indoors or outdoors, products will make your trip amazing. Please prepare 2 AAA batteries for your baby before use.

【Perfect Gift】Fun and unique ways of learning will enhance your child's cognition, develop their senses and allow them to grow in joy. This is the perfect gift for birthdays, Christmas and festivals. The size of this product is 7.1*6.3*1.1 inches.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very engaging and interesting for toddlers
reviews.reviewText: My almost 2yo is very happy with this product. Only needs 2 AAA batteries and it’s very engaging for a toddler. It kept her distracted for a while and that’s already a win! Every switch turns a different light on. Some of the pros I’ve seen so far are that helps with fine motor skills, independent play and recognition of colors.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great busy board
reviews.reviewText: I bought this as an incentive for an autistic child, but it ended up being a great addition to my break corner overall. I was initially disappointed by the small size, but over time I realized that the portability of it is great as we transition from different locations. There's so many different methods to turn on that it can keep the kiddos busy and is a great for "work first, then lights" motivator. One thing I noticed though is that some of my kids struggled with the ones that were not simple on-off switches, so it was a great learning experience for them to figure out the knobs. The only thing I don't like about this is that there isn't a way to turn off everything with one switch, which means if I am not paying attention and one of them leaves just one light on, it's draining the battery overnight.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great things to spend your baby’s time
reviews.reviewText: It was really great as recommended by a friend. There are many buttons and many ways to play. The baby can play quietly all afternoon. It can be a good exercise for baby's finger flexibility and response to light switches. A very good game.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is so compact and easy for travel. Our toddler loves it. Easy to keep them entertained in the car or on flights to visit family. Lots of switches! We don’t always use the lights but it still entertains!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for my toddler nephew!
reviews.reviewText: My nephew is 2 and I gave this to him as a gift. I was skeptical at first because it was smaller than I realized when I ordered it, but it was perfect! It was the perfect size for little curious hands. He loved switching and twisting everything and it kept him busy. The product is well made and sturdy, I recommend this!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 13, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This kept my 2-year-old entertained through the entirety of a three hour road trip and most of the drive back, too. That alone made it worth the buy. He also plays with it frequently at home and will choose the board over screen time. Lightweight! Even keeps my 28 year old husband entertained 😂

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Busy board is a great development tool for my 2 yr old
reviews.reviewText: I recently purchased the Busy Board for my 2-year-old daughter, and it’s been an exceptional educational tool. With its variety of activities, it aids in developing fine motor skills, cognitive growth, and hand-eye coordination.The Busy Board’s diversity in design is commendable. Latches, buttons, and zippers engage my daughter while challenging her and promoting problem-solving skills. The sturdy, child-safe materials, smooth edges, and non-toxic finishes ensure a safe play environment.What sets the Busy Board apart is its blend of learning and play, providing valuable life skills in an enjoyable manner. Its portability makes it great for car rides and outdoor activities.I highly recommend the Busy Board to parents of toddlers. It’s a worthwhile investment in your child’s developmental journey, offering endless fun and learning opportunities!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Some lights not that bright on it.
reviews.reviewText: We got one before this one for my son, and the key part broke on it but he liked playing with it and always hands it to us to help him or to play with him. So we got this to replace that one that seemed cheaper quality. But the one con of this one is either the batteries are partially already dead or some of the lights don’t brighten up as well as the older one. But the switches seem to be a lot better quality.
